w:r.w:t: The purpose of this document is to define the functional and non-functional requirements for a macOS-based diagram software that allows users to create flowcharts, app flows, ER diagrams, and mind maps.

This software provides an infinite 2D canvas for creating structured diagrams. It supports adding main topics, subtopics, and relationships between them using intuitive keyboard and mouse interactions. The application enables users to zoom, pan, edit, and export diagrams efficiently.
UX/UI Best Practices for Diagramming Tools
Users can scroll infinitely in all directions.
Zoom in and out with pinch gestures or keyboard shortcuts.
Pan across the canvas using mouse drag.
Topics and subtopics appear as rectangles.
Default names: "Main Topic 1", "Main Topic N", "Subtopic 1", "Subtopic N".
from one topic to another to create a relationship.
Support for different line styles (dotted, solid, arrows).
to edit text inside a topic.
Change shape colors, borders, and font styles.
Resize and move topics/subtopics while maintaining connections.
Auto-align elements in a structured manner.
Save diagrams in JSON format for future editing.
Users should have basic familiarity with macOS UI.
No cloud collaboration in the initial version.
The system shall provide an infinite scrollable and zoomable 2D canvas.
The system shall allow users to add main topics by pressing the
The system shall allow users to add subtopics by pressing the
The system shall allow users to create relationships by
The system shall allow users to edit text inside a shape by pressing the
The system shall allow users to export diagrams in PNG, SVG, and PDF formats.
The system shall provide undo and redo functionality.
The system shall auto-arrange elements in a structured layout.
The system shall handle up to
The UI shall be intuitive and follow macOS
The system shall persist data locally for offline use.
for custom rendering of the infinite canvas.
for dragging, selecting, and creating relationships.
Return (Add Topic), Tab (Add Subtopic), Control + Drag (Create Relationship), Space (Edit Text)
Supported Formats: JSON, PNG, SVG, PDF.
